title: Advanced Tip: Two Ways To Keep Your Remove Tool Variations
description: Mornin’, everybody. This tip is way better than the headline makes it sound. Here’s the situation (and then the tip): Even though those variations go away in the Remove panel, they haven’t gone away in the History panel, and not only does the History panel list them, it even lists which variations by number (see below). You can see here the last things I did to this image was select new variations (after generating a new set), but earlier (actually, on a different day), I had the original set of variations and I can go back and choose any one of these, even though I can’t access them from the Remove panel. Another method would be to go to the Snapshots panels and create Snapshots of your favorite variations before you hit the Generate button in the Remove Panel. That way, they’re saved before you create new variations. Have a great Monday, everybody! 🙂 The post Advanced Tip: Two Ways To Keep Your Remove Tool Variations appeared first on Lightroom Killer Tips.
author: Scott Kelby

html:
Mornin’, everybody. This tip is way better than the headline makes it sound. Here’s the situation (and then the tip):

  1. You used the Remove tool, with the Generative AI checkbox turned on
  2. You went through the three variations it gave you, and there was one you liked okay, but you weren’t 100% thrilled with any of the results
  3. You hit ‘Regenerate,” knowing that the initial three variations would no longer be available.
  4. You realize, after regenerating, the best result was actually in the initial three variations, but those are gone now, because you regenerated. Now, here’s the tip:

Even though those variations go away in the Remove panel, they haven’t gone away in the History panel, and not only does the History panel list them, it even lists which variations by number (see below).

You can see here the last things I did to this image was select new variations (after generating a new set), but earlier (actually, on a different day), I had the original set of variations and I can go back and choose any one of these, even though I can’t access them from the Remove panel.

Another method would be to go to the Snapshots panels and create Snapshots of your favorite variations before you hit the Generate button in the Remove Panel. That way, they’re saved before you create new variations.

Have a great Monday, everybody! 🙂
